Node.definition: = woman, also known as Sarah (שָׂרָה) ► wife of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and mother of Isaac (יִצְחָק)

= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

Node.gloss: to be worthless|to be insignificant|to be of no account
Node.definition: = state in which humans have a reduced value or reduced importance, mostly in the eyes of someone else
= woman who is in a position of authority over another person as a legal owner, employer, or sovereign

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= process by which someone becomes pregnant

Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process by which humans or objects come upon (other) humans or objects without searching
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= hole in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= hole in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= location ◄ east of Egypt

= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= wild donkey of a relatively large size but with relatively small ears; it has a fawn color with a whitish chest and belly; ◄ Persian Wild Ass or Onager, Equus hemonius; ≈ associated with both untameable wildness and sexual desire
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon

= hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄ usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life
= location, perhaps a shrine; ◄ between Kadesh (קָדֵשׁ) and Bered (בֶּרֶד) in the Negeb (נֶגֶב) ► named by Hagar (הָגָר) after a messenger of God spoke with her; Isaac (יִצְחָק) later settled there

Node.definition: = the area separating two or mores locations

= town, also known as En Mishpat (עֵין מִשְׁפָּט) , Kedesh (קֶדֶשׁ) and Kadesh Barnea (קָדֵשׁ בַּרְנֵעַ) ◄ located in the Wilderness of Zin (צִן) in the northern part of Sinai (סִינַי) peninsula; ► Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) encamped there on their way from Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) to Canaan (כְּנַעַן) it is also the location of the Meribah (מְרִיבָה) spring; spies were sent out into Canaan from this place; it later marked the southern border of the territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
